subject: Business
title: Bottleneck Theory: The Weakest Link
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Bottleneck Theory: The Weakest Link.

hook.text: A factory produces 100 units per hour at every station except one that does 60. Total output: 60.

buildup.text: Eliyahu Goldratt's Theory of Constraints says every system has one bottleneck that limits total throughput.

discovery.text: Improving anything except the bottleneck wastes resources. Only bottleneck improvements increase output.

twist.text: Once you fix one bottleneck, a new one appears. The system always has exactly one constraint.

climax.text: Goldratt's 'The Goal' showed that a factory doubled output by focusing on just one machine.

punchline.text: Find the bottleneck. Everything else can wait.

quiz.question: According to the Theory of Constraints, what should you improve first?
options: The single bottleneck limiting total throughput
